judaismPage.title: Judaism
judaismPage.intro: Judaism is an ancient monotheistic religion based on the teachings of the Torah and the traditions of the Jewish people.
judaismPage.rabbiDesc: Spiritual guidance and advice on religious practice
judaismPage.holidaysDesc: Calendar of Jewish holidays and their significance in religious tradition
judaismPage.traditionsDesc: Rites, customs and practices passed down from generation to generation
judaismPage.faithP1: Judaism is founded on belief in one God and observance of the commandments of the Torah. It is not just a religion but a way of life that unites the spiritual, ethical and cultural traditions of the Jewish people.
judaismPage.faithP2: In our union we study sacred texts, observe holidays and maintain a connection with the centuries-old traditions of our ancestors.
judaismPage.lifeDesc: We hold regular services, study the Torah, celebrate holidays and life-cycle events according to Jewish traditions. Our community is open to everyone who seeks spiritual growth and the study of Judaism.

heritagePage.title: Heritage
heritagePage.intro: The rich cultural and spiritual heritage of the Jewish people in Belarus spans many centuries. We work to preserve historical monuments, traditions and to pass knowledge on to the younger generation.
heritagePage.toursDesc: Explore historic Jewish sites in Belarus through interactive virtual tours that let you discover the rich heritage from the comfort of your home.
heritagePage.projectDesc: A comprehensive project to document and preserve Jewish heritage in Belarus, including research, archival work and educational programmes.
heritagePage.cemeteriesP1: We work to preserve and restore Jewish cemeteries throughout Belarus. These sacred sites are an important part of our historical heritage.
heritagePage.cemeteriesP2: Our activities include documenting tombstones, installing memorial plaques and creating memorial alleys to preserve the memory of past generations.
heritagePage.lapidariumDesc: We are implementing a unique project to build the first Jewish lapidarium in Brest — an open-air museum that will display historical tombstones and monuments of the region's Jewish culture.
heritagePage.centerDesc: Our center conducts research, collects archival materials and organises educational programmes for the study and preservation of the Jewish cultural heritage of Belarus.

projectsPage.title: Projects
projectsPage.intro: Our projects are aimed at community development, preserving traditions and supporting those in need. We implement a variety of initiatives in the areas of culture, education and social assistance.
projectsPage.newspaperP1: Our regular publication covers the life of the Jewish community in Belarus, publishes historical materials and reports on traditions and current events in community life.
projectsPage.newspaperP2: The newspaper serves as an important link between communities in various cities and regions of the country.
projectsPage.lapidariumP1: Building the first Jewish lapidarium in Brest is a large-scale project to create an open-air museum that will display historical tombstones and monuments.
projectsPage.lapidariumP2: The project is aimed at preserving the material heritage of the regional Jewish community for future generations.
projectsPage.centerDesc: A research and educational center that collects, systematises and studies materials on Jewish history and culture in Belarus. The center hosts academic conferences, seminars and publishes scholarly works.
projectsPage.aidP1: Every year we provide support to large families and people with disabilities. Our programme includes material aid, food packages and social support.
projectsPage.aidP2: We believe that mutual aid and caring for others is the foundation of a strong community.
projectsPage.archivesDesc: We work to collect, digitise and preserve archival documents, photographs and other materials related to the history of Jewish communities in Belarus. This project helps preserve the memory of the past and provide access to historical materials for researchers.

eventsPage.title: Events
eventsPage.intro: Calendar of upcoming events, holidays and services of our community. Follow updates so you don't miss important events.
eventsPage.calendarDesc: We celebrate all traditional Jewish holidays, including Rosh Hashanah, Yom Kippur, Sukkot, Hanukkah, Purim and Passover. Each holiday is accompanied by special services and community events.
eventsPage.hanukkahDesc: — The Festival of Lights, celebrated for eight days with candle lighting and traditional games and treats.
eventsPage.conferencesDesc: Annual conferences to discuss important issues in community development and plan activities
eventsPage.booksDesc: Events dedicated to presenting new publications on Jewish history and culture
eventsPage.memorialDesc: Commemorative events in honour of Holocaust victims and other tragic events in Jewish history
eventsPage.joinDesc: All events are open to community members and guests. For detailed information about times and venues, please contact your local community leadership or the central office.

galleryPage.title: Gallery
galleryPage.intro: Photo gallery of events, activities and important moments from the life of our community. Here you'll find memorable photos of holidays, ceremonies and everyday community life.
galleryPage.holidaysDesc: Photos from celebrations of traditional Jewish holidays: Hanukkah, Purim, Passover, Rosh Hashanah and other important dates in community life.
galleryPage.synagoguesDesc: Photos of synagogues, community centers and religious ceremonies in various cities of Belarus.
galleryPage.educationDesc: Photos of seminars, lectures, Torah study and other educational programmes for children and adults.
galleryPage.shareDesc: If you have photos from community events or historical images you would like to share, please contact us through the contact form. Together we will preserve the memory of important moments in our community life.
